original_table_html:
Tomato sauce (ketchup) brands Market share (%) Penetration (%) Frequency of buying this brand (units per annum) Frequency of buying any tomato sauce (units per annum)
Heinz 53 50 2.9 4
Daddies sauce 4 5 2 6
C&B sauce 1 2 1.2 8
summary_markdown: This data presents a comparative analysis of three tomato sauce (ketchup) brands: Heinz, Daddies sauce, and C&B sauce, detailing their market performance. Heinz dominates the market with a 53% market share and 50% penetration, indicating widespread consumer adoption. Its customers purchase Heinz an average of 2.9 times per annum, contributing to a total of 4 annual purchases of any tomato sauce. In contrast, Daddies sauce holds a 4% market share and 5% penetration, with consumers buying it twice annually, and a higher overall frequency of 6 annual tomato sauce purchases. C&B sauce has the smallest market presence at 1% share and 2% penetration, yet its consumers exhibit the highest frequency of buying any tomato sauce at 8 times per annum, with individual C&B purchases averaging 1.2 times. The structure is comparative, highlighting key performance indicators across different brands.
